availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Ewing Halsell (County Attorney of Warren County)

body.p: Bowling Green, Kentucky attorney, farmer, and County Attorney. Warren County native. Attended Cumberland University, Lebanon, Tennessee. Studied law under Garland J. Blewett in Bowling Green. Married Sarah A. Smith Halsell in 1849. Admitted to the bar in 1856. Elder of Cumberland Presbyterian Church from 1856 to c. 1878. Held eight slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: The Biographical Encyclop√¶dia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century (Cincinnati, OH: J. M. Armstrong and Company, 1878), p. 128.
